title: If you can't beat 'em, join 'em...
body: <p>...or something like that. Since Kraft, Wal-Mart, &amp; Dean Foods can't easily produce organic foods, they're basically trying to get the definition of "organic" changed.</p><blockquote>[...] large corporations such as Kraft, Wal-Mart, &amp; Dean Foods--aided and abetted by the U.S. Department of Agriculture (USDA) are moving to lower organic standards by allowing a Bush appointee to create a list of synthetic ingredients that would be allowed organic production [...]</blockquote><p>There's <a href="http://www.organicconsumers.org/sos.cfm" title="Safeguard Organic Standards">more info at the Organic Consumers Association <acronym title="Safeguard Organic Standards">SOS</acronym> page</a>.</p>
